docs.snippet: CITY MORTALITY.-The health officer reports 116 deaths for the week ending Saturday last. They are classified as follows: Men, 19; women, 23; boys, 41; girls, 33. Adults, 42; children, 74. Males, 60; females, 56. Colored persons, 2. There are 20...
docs.lead_paragraph: CITY MORTALITY.-The health officer reports 116 deaths for the week ending Saturday last. They are classified as follows: Men, 19; women, 23; boys, 41; girls, 33. Adults, 42; children, 74. Males, 60; females, 56. Colored persons, 2. There are 20 deaths by consumption; 10 by infantile convulsions; eight, each by croup and inflammation of the lungs; six by premature birth ; and seven by infantile debility.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEPARTURE OF STEAMERS. - A large number of passengers left this port on Saturday by various steamers. The steamer Baltic, Capt. A. G. GRAY, of the North Atlantic line to California, left at 2 o'clock P .M., with about one thousand passengers, among whom were Dr. FRANK TUTHILL and family, Col. DANIEL W. TELLER, who goes out as bearer of dispatches to Mr. JONES,

docs.snippet: The steamship North American, from Liverpool, at 10 A. M. of the 26th ult., passed Father Point at 2:15 P. M. yesterday, en route to Quebec, The City of Baltimore, for New-York, was to sail about an hour later, and the Vanderbilt was to leave...

headline.main: NEWS FROM EUROPE.; GENERAL AND COMMERCIAL INTELLIGENCE. Threatened Rupture Between France and England. The North American at Quebec--The America at Boston. THE TREATY OF ZURICH.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship North American, from Liverpool, at 10 A. M. of the 26th ult., passed Father Point at 2:15 P. M. yesterday, en route to Quebec, The City of Baltimore, for New-York, was to sail about an hour later, and the Vanderbilt was to leave Southampton the same day. The steamship Asia, from New-York, arrived at Liverpool at 3 P. M. of the 24th.

docs.snippet: The Philadelphia Evening Journal has the following paragraph concerning Mr. Paul Morphy: "At the Atheneum, yesterday, Mr. Montgomery had just taken his seat to play, but a question of chess etiquette arose which prevented the game. Mr. Montgomery...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Philadelphia Evening Journal has the following paragraph concerning Mr. Paul Morphy: "At the Atheneum, yesterday, Mr. Montgomery had just taken his seat to play, but a question of chess etiquette arose which prevented the game. Mr. Montgomery thought that his reputation is such that he was entitled to play without receiving odds, and Mr. Morphy has made it a rule since his return from Europe not to play an even game.

docs.snippet: POSTMASTER-GENERAL HOLT-SINGULAR ACCIDENT. Correspondence of the Baltimore Sun. Postmaster-General HOLT leaves in the mail steamer this evening to accompany his wife, who is in feeble health, to a Southern clime, where she intends to spend the...
docs.lead_paragraph: POSTMASTER-GENERAL HOLT-SINGULAR ACCIDENT. Correspondence of the Baltimore Sun. Postmaster-General HOLT leaves in the mail steamer this evening to accompany his wife, who is in feeble health, to a Southern clime, where she intends to spend the Winter. The head of the Department will be absent but a few days.

headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; British Treaties with Central American States--Mr. Dimitry at Sun Jose--The Mexican Negotiations--Reopening of the Tehuantepec Route, &c. FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: Letters from San Jose state that Sir WILLIAM GORE OUSELEY has arranged a treaty, which only remains to be signed, with. Costa Rica, President MARTINEZ, of Nicaragua, has also acceded to the British Mosquito treaty , which is now pending before the Chamber of Deputies. The special mission of Sir WILLIAM being thus ended, and his health requiring change, he returns immediately to England.

docs.snippet: We were led to believe from the charge of Judge PARKER to the Grand Jury, when the proceedings in Old BROWN'S case first commenced, that great care was about to be taken by the Virginian authorities to assure to the unfortunate criminal and his not...
docs.lead_paragraph: We were led to believe from the charge of Judge PARKER to the Grand Jury, when the proceedings in Old BROWN'S case first commenced, that great care was about to be taken by the Virginian authorities to assure to the unfortunate criminal and his not less unfortunate associates a full and fair trial.

headline.main: THE VIRGINIA REBELLION.; SIXTH DAY. Appeal of the Counsel for the Defense. Brown Found Guilty of Treason, Insurrection and Murder. TRIAL OF JOHN BROWN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Court met at nine o'clock. The prisoner was brought in, and the trial proceeded without delay. Brown looks better than heretofore, and his health is evidently improving. He was laid on a bed as usual. The Court-house and its approaches were densely crowded.
